author: benjaminion
content: <@!203220829473996800> can confirm that Teku considers valid any message with signature and pubkey being the points at infinity in the respective subgroups. I can't find anything in the IETF draft that covers this case, and the math checks out, so I'm assuming this makes sense. There doesn't seem to have been a fork on Witti, and the validator has been inducted, so it looks like Teku, LH and Prysm all agree about this.

author: ajsutton
content: I’m running three teku nodes. There was a period around 2am UTC where witti went 40 epochs without finalising. We’re still working to avoid memory growth during nonfinalisation. Two of my nodes struggled, one restarted a couple of times before finality was restored and they went back to normal.

author: ajsutton
content: The third node is on my recent code and sailed through without an issue which Is nice
